intro: Oocephalus tenuithyrsus, commonly known as the narrow-bracted oocephalus, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tubular, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its botanical features make it a valuable species for ecological studies and ornamental gardening.
